div.title: Files

td.pre: #' Try parsing dates with multiple formats
#' This helper function attempts to parse dates using specified formats and
#' handles ISO 8601 formatted dates (containing 'T') separately using ymd_hms.
#' @param x A character vector of dates to parse
#' @param formats A character vector of date formats to try (see ?strptime for
#' @return A POSIXct vector of parsed dates
#' A character vector containing all supported date formats that can be parsed
#' by `autoparse_dates()`. These formats follow standard date-time components:
#' @format A character vector of date format strings
"d B Y", "B d, Y", "Y B d",
"d B y", "B d, y", "y B d",
"d b Y", "b d, Y", "Y b d",
"d b y", "b d, y", "y b d",
#' Parse Dates in a Data Frame
#' This function parses date columns in a data frame using various date
#' formats. It standardizes the output to a specified format and provides
#' @param data A data frame containing columns with date values to parse.
#' @param date_cols A character vector specifying the names of columns with
#' @param output_format A character string specifying the desired output format
#' for the parsed dates. Default is \code{"\%Y-\%m-\%d"}.
#' @param additional_format A character string specifying any additional formats
#' that are not included in the default formats
#' @param verbose Logical. If \code{TRUE}, prints messages about parsing
#' success or failure for each column. Default is \code{TRUE}.
#' @return Returns the original data frame with the specified date columns
#' This function supports a wide range of date formats, including:
# set up formats by also including additional formats
"Warning: {result} dates could not be parsed in column '{col}'"
"All columns have been successfully parsed to the given format"
#' Check Leap Year Issues in Date Column
#' This function checks if the dates in the given column have leap year issues.
#' It identifies dates that are February 29 in a non-leap year.
#' @param date_col A character vector representing date values.
#' @return A logical vector indicating which dates have leap year issues.
date_col <- gsub("T.*$", "", date_col) # remove time from date
#' This function checks and validates a date column in a data frame. It
#' performs various checks for missing dates, non-date values, sensible dates,
#' leap year validity, and date formatting.
#' @param data A data frame containing the date column.
#' @param date_col The name of the date column.
#' @param tests A character vector specifying which tests to run. Default is
#' @param min_year The minimum year to consider as valid. Default is 2000.
#' @return The modified data frame with additional columns indicating issues
#' # check whether dates column is valid
#' # Check for countries where there is a non-date issue in the date column
#' # Check for countries where there is an invalid leap year issue
#' # Check for countries where there is improper formatting of the date
# parse datest correctly at the start
cli::cli_alert_success("Date column has fully valid dates!")
" date(s) with a year greater than the current year! Check column ",
" invalid leap year date(s)! Check column ",
cli::cli_alert_success("Date column has no leap year issues!")
cli::cli_alert_success("Date column has no formatting issues!")
#' This function checks and validates two date columns in a data frame. It
#' performs various checks for missing dates, non-date values, sensible dates,
#' leap year validity, date formatting, similarity in date formatting, and
#' if the first date is before the second date.
#' @param data A data frame containing the date columns.
#' @param date_col1 The name of the first date column.
#' @param date_col2 The name of the second date column.
#' @param tests A character vector specifying which tests to run. Default is
#' @param min_year The minimum year to consider as valid. Default is 2000.
#' @return The modified data frame with additional columns indicating issues
#' # Check for countries where there is a non-date issue in the date1 column
#' # Check for countries where there is an invalid leap year issue in date1
#' # Check for countries where there is improper formatting of date1 col
#' # Check for countries where date1 is after date2
# parse datest correctly at the start
cli::cli_alert_success("Both date columns have fully valid dates!")
" date(s) with a year greater than the current year! Check column ",
" date(s) with a year greater than the current year! Check column ",
cli::cli_alert_success("Both date columns have sensible dates!")
" invalid leap year date(s)! Check column ",
" invalid leap year date(s)! Check column ",
cli::cli_alert_success("Both date columns have no leap year issues!")
cli::cli_alert_success("Both date columns have no formatting issues!")
" while date column ", crayon::blue(date_col2), " has format ", date2_fmt,
cli::cli_alert_success("Both date columns have the same format!")
# 7: Check if the first date is before the second date -----------------------
cli::cli_h1("Check if the first date is before the second date")
" instances where the first date is not before the second date! ",
cli::cli_alert_success("All date pairs are in the correct order!")
#' Check for Missing Values in a Data Frame
#' This function analyzes a data frame for missing values, providing both
#' counts and percentages of missing data for specified columns or all columns
#' if not specified. It also allows grouping by one or more variables.
#' @param data A data frame to check for missing values.
#' @param cols_to_check An optional character vector of column names to check.
#' If NULL (default), all columns are checked.
#' @param key_columns An optional character vector of column names that
#' are considered key for the analysis. Any missing values in these
#' columns will be flagged as "High Priority" in the output.
#' @param group_by An optional character vector of column names to group by.
#' If provided, missing values will be calculated within each group.
#' \item{Missing Count}{The number of missing values in the column}
#' \item{Missing Percent}{The percentage of missing values in the column}
#' \item{Priority}{Indicates if the column is "High Priority" or "Standard"}
#' \item{Is Completely Null}{Indicates if the column is completely null}
#' If grouping is used, additional columns for each grouping variable will be
#' a = c(1, 2, NA), b = c("x", NA, "z"), c = c(TRUE, FALSE, TRUE),
# If no columns specified, use all columns except grouping variables
`Is Completely Null` = ifelse(`Missing Percent` == 100, TRUE, FALSE),
# drop Priority col if key column
# Initialize a list to store results
# Loop through each row in the result
# Check if there are missing values
# Report on columns with missing values

"The number of name columns must match, ",

#' Check and validate data across multiple dimensions
#' This function performs comprehensive checks on a dataset, including missing
#' data, data types, date validations, geographic hierarchy, geo-name and ID
#' @param data A data frame containing the dataset to be checked.
#' @param id_col Character string specifying the name of the ID column.
#' @param geo_name_cols Character vector of column names containing geographic
#' @param geo_id_cols Character vector of column names containing geographic
#' @param date_cols Character vector of column names containing dates.
#' @param date_pair_cols List of character vectors, each containing a pair of
#' date column names to be compared.
#' @param lat_long_cols Character vector of two column names containing
#' @param shapefile_data Optional data frame containing shapefile data for
#' @param shapefile_join_key Optional character string specifying the join key
#' @param correct_lat_col Optional character string specifying the column name
#' for correct latitude in shapefile data.
#' @param correct_lon_col Optional character string specifying the column name
#' for correct longitude in shapefile data.
#' @param shapefile_name_cols Optional character vector of column names in
#' @param shapefile_id_cols Optional character vector of column names in
#' @param run_missing_check Logical, whether to run missing data check.
#' @param run_date_check Logical, whether to run date validation checks.
#' @param run_geo_hierarchy_check Logical, whether to run geographic hierarchy
#' @param run_geo_mismatch_check Logical, whether to run geographic mismatch
#' @param run_coordinate_checks Logical, whether to run coordinate checks.
#' @param run_detections Logical, whether to run virus detections checks.
#' @param coordinate_checks Character vector specifying which coordinate checks
#' @return A list containing the following elements:
#' \item{missing_data}{Data frame summarizing missing data and data types for
#' \item{geo_mismatches}{Data frame summarizing mismatches between data and
#' # With shapefile data and date pairs:
# 1b. Data type check for all columns
# add data type check to missing data
dplyr::mutate(Test = glue::glue("{col} is in the future"))
dplyr::mutate(Test = glue::glue("{col} has leap year issue"))
# add date results pairs to results
# add date results pairs to results
dplyr::if_else(WILD1 == TRUE, TRUE, FALSE, missing = FALSE)
#' Create a Summary Table from Data Quality Check Results
#' This function takes the results of various data quality checks and creates a
#' unified summary table. It processes different types of checks including
#' overall data summary, coordinate checks, geographical mismatches,
#' geographical hierarchy, date checks, and date pair checks.
#' @param data A list containing the results of various data quality checks.
#' The list may include the following components:
#' - total_rows: Total number of rows in the dataset
#' - total_columns: Total number of columns in the dataset
#' - coordinate_checks: Results of coordinate validity checks
#' - geo_mismatches: Results of geographical mismatches with shapefile
#' - geo_hierarchy: Results of geographical hierarchy checks
#' - date_results: Results of individual date column checks
#' - date_results_pairs: Results of date pair checks
#' - header: The category of the check (factor)
#' - Column: The specific item being checked
#' - count: The count or measure of the item (numeric)
#' The function processes each type of check separately and then combines them
#' into a single table. It also renames and recodes some of the column names
#' # Assuming 'results' is the output from a data quality check function
"Coordinates On Water (Sea, Ocean, Lake or River)",
"Non-date Value (Cannot be converted to date format)",
"Invalid Date Order (First date is after second date)",
"Coordinates Out Of Bounds (Not Within -90 To 90, -180 To 180)",
"Coordinates On Water Bodies (Sea, Ocean, Lake Or River)",
"Invalid Date Order (First Date Is After Second Date)"
#' This function creates a summary of data quality checks grouped by a specified
#' @param data A data frame containing the dataset to be summarized.
#' @param group_var The name of the column to group by.
#' @param id_col The name of the column containing unique identifiers.
#' @param geo_name_cols A vector of column names containing geographic names.
#' @param geo_id_cols A vector of column names containing geographic IDs.
#' @param lat_long_cols A vector of column names for latitude and longitude.
#' @param date_cols A vector of column names containing dates.
#' @param date_pair_cols A list of date column pairs to be checked together.
#' @param shapefile_data Optional data frame containing shapefile data for
#' @param shapefile_join_key Optional character string specifying the join key
#' @param correct_lat_col Optional character string specifying the column name
#' for correct latitude in shapefile data.
#' @param correct_lon_col Optional character string specifying the column name
#' for correct longitude in shapefile data.
#' @param shapefile_name_cols Optional character vector of column names in
#' @param shapefile_id_cols Optional character vector of column names in
#' @param run_missing_check Logical; if TRUE, runs missing data check (default
#' @param run_date_check Logical; if TRUE, runs date validation check (default
#' @param run_geo_hierarchy_check Logical; if TRUE, runs geographic hierarchy
#' @param run_geo_mismatch_check Logical; if TRUE, runs geographic mismatch
#' @param run_coordinate_checks Logical; if TRUE, runs coordinate validation
#' @param run_detections Logical, whether to run virus detections checks.
#' @param coordinate_checks Character vector specifying which coordinate checks
#' @param n_groups The number of groups to include in the summary (def is 4).
#' @param decreasing Logical; if TRUE, sorts groups in decreasing order (default
#' @return A data frame containing the combined summary of data quality checks
#' This function performs the following steps:
#' 1. Selects unique groups based on the specified group variable.
#' 2. For each group, it runs data quality checks using `check_data`.
#' 3. Creates a summary table for each group using the `create_summary_table`
#' 4. Combines the results into a single data frame, with groups as columns.
# Get unique groups and sort them
#' Create a GT Table for Data Quality Summary
#' This function creates a formatted GT table from a summary of data quality
#' @param summary_data A data frame containing the summary of data quality
#' @param title A string for the table title. Default is "Summary of POLIS Data
#' @param add_nanoplot A logical indicating whether to add a nanoplot column.
#' @param row_start An integer indicating the starting row for data color
#' @param autoscale_nanoplot Logical. Whether to autoscale the nanoplot.
#' @return A GT table object with formatted data quality summary.
#' The function applies various formatting and styling to the summary data:
#' - Applies color scaling to numeric columns based on their values.
#' - Formats numbers to remove decimal places.
#' - Optionally adds a nanoplot column for visualizing trends.
title = "Summary of POLIS Data Quality Checks",
" required but not installed. Please install them."
# Handle potential negative values or NAs for this row
#' This function performs data quality checks on POLIS (Polio Information
#' @param data A dataframe containing the POLIS data to be validated.
#' @param type Character string specifying the data type. Either "AFP" or "ES".
#' @param group_var Optional. The column name to group the data by. If NULL,
#' @param id_col Optional. The column name for the unique identifier. If NULL,
#' @param geo_name_cols Optional. A vector of column names for geographic names.
#' @param geo_id_cols Optional. A vector of column names for geographic IDs.
#' @param lat_long_cols Optional. A vector of column names for latitude and
#' @param date_cols Optional. A vector of column names for date fields. If NULL,
#' @param date_pair_cols Optional. A list of date column pairs for comparison.
#' @param n_groups Integer. The number of groups to display in the summary.
#' @param decreasing Logical. Whether to sort the groups in decreasing order.
#' @param plots_path Optional. The file path to save output plots. Required if
#' @param polis_version Character string. The version of POLIS being used.
#' @param custom_title Optional. A custom title for the output table.
#' @param save_output Logical. Whether to save the output as HTML and PNG.
#' @param vheight Integer. The height of the output image in pixels.
#' @param vwidth Integer. The width of the output image in pixels. Default
#' @param autoscale_nanoplot Logical. Whether to autoscale the nanoplot.
#' @param ... Additional arguments passed to internal functions.
#' \item{gt_table}{A gt table object with the validation summary}
#' \item{id_data}{A dataframe with detailed information for each unique
#' This function performs various data quality checks on POLIS data, including
#' checks for missing values, geographic data consistency, date field validity,
#' and more. It allows for customization of column names and grouping
#' variables, making it flexible for different data structures within the
#' The function will use default parameters based on the specified data type
#' (AFP or ES) if custom parameters are not provided. It also checks if all
#' specified columns exist in the dataset before proceeding with the analysis.
#' # Assuming polis_data is your dataset and you have the necessary dependencies
#' # Access the GT table and ID data
" required but not installed. Please install them."
# Define parameters based on data type
# Use provided parameters if not NULL, otherwise use defaults
# Check if all specified columns exist in the dataset
"The following columns are not present in the dataset:",
stop("plots_path must be provided when save_output is TRUE")
webshot::webshot(html_path, png_path, vheight = vheight, vwidth = vwidth)
#' This function validates POLIS data snapshots for a specific year and data
#' @param path Character. Directory path containing POLIS snapshot files.
#' @param data_type Character. Type of data ("AFP" or "ES"). Default is "AFP".
#' @param plots_path Character. Directory to save output plots.
#' @param custom_title Character. Custom title for the output. Default is NULL.
#' @param data_type_string String of data list name
#' @param year_of_interest Numeric. Year of interest for validation. Default is
#' @param pattern Character. Pattern to match snapshot files. Default is NULL.
#' @param snapshots Numeric. Number of snapshots to validate. Default is 6.
#' @param vheight Integer. The height of the output image in pixels.
#' Default is 1400. Corresponds to the default 6 snapshots.
#' @param vwidth Integer. The width of the output image in pixels. Default
#' is 1760. Corresponds to the default 6 snapshots.
#' @param ... Additional arguments passed to validate_polis function.
#' @return A list containing validation results and GT table.
"POLIS %s Data Quality Checks For Data Snapshots (%d-%d)",
#' This function performs data quality checks on a given dataset and produces

#' @param plots_path Optional. The file path to save output plots. Required if
#' @param custom_title Optional. A custom title for the output table.
#' @param save_output Logical. Whether to save the output as HTML and PNG.

#' This function performs various data quality checks on AFRO data before it is
#' sent to POLIS, including checks for missing values, geographic data
#' consistency, date field validity, and more. It allows for customization of
#' column names and grouping variables, making it flexible for different data

#' (AFP or ES) if custom parameters are not provided. It also checks if all
#' specified columns exist in the dataset before proceeding with the analysis.

" required but not installed. Please install them."

webshot::webshot(html_path, png_path, vheight = vheight, vwidth = vwidth)
#' This function formats numbers by adding a thousand separator (big mark)
#' and optionally rounding to a specified number of decimal places.
#' @param x A numeric vector to be formatted.
#' @param decimals An integer specifying the number of decimal places to
#' round to. Default is NULL, which means no rounding is performed.
#' @param big_mark A character to use as the thousand separator.
#' @return A character vector of formatted numbers.
big.mark = big_mark, scientific = FALSE, trim = TRUE,
#' This helper function performs common setup tasks for coordinate operations.
#' @param data A dataframe containing the geographical coordinates.
#' @param shapefile_data Optional. A dataframe containing reference shapefile
#' @param join_key_a The column name in `data` to join with `shapefile_data`.
#' @param join_key_b Optional. The column name in `shapefile_data` to join with
#' @param lat_col The name of the latitude column in `data`.
#' @param lon_col The name of the longitude column in `data`.
#' @param correct_lat_col Optional. The name of the correct latitude column in
#' @param correct_lon_col Optional. The name of the correct longitude column in
#' @return A list containing processed data and shapefile data.
# Use poliprep::shp_global if shapefile_data is not provided
"is not present in the data dataframe."
#' Check for Potentially Flipped Geographical Coordinates
#' This function checks for potentially flipped latitude and longitude
#' coordinates by comparing them with a reference shapefile, without actually
#' @return A dataframe with additional columns indicating whether coordinates
#' are potentially flipped and the distances to the correct coordinates.
# Use poliprep::shp_global if shapefile_data is not provided
# Use poliprep::shp_global if shapefile_data is not provided
# Calculate the number of potentially flipped coordinates
# Use cli to give a report
"{num_flipped} out of {total_coords} coordinates are potentially flipped."
cli::cli_alert_success("No coordinates appear to be flipped.")
#' Calculate Haversine Distance Between Two Geographic Points
#' This function calculates the Haversine distance between two points on the
#' Earth's surface, given their longitude and latitude coordinates. It includes
#' @param lon1 Numeric. Longitude of the first point in decimal degrees.
#' @param lat1 Numeric. Latitude of the first point in decimal degrees.
#' @param lon2 Numeric. Longitude of the second point in decimal degrees.
#' @param lat2 Numeric. Latitude of the second point in decimal degrees.
#' @return Numeric. The Haversine distance between the two points in meters.
#' Returns NA if any of the coordinates are invalid or if an error
#' The function first checks if any of the input coordinates are outside the
#' valid range (latitude between -90 and 90 degrees, longitude between -180 and
#' 180 degrees). If any coordinate is invalid, it returns NA.
#' If all coordinates are valid, it uses the geosphere::distHaversine function
#' to calculate the distance. Any errors during this calculation are caught,
#' and NA is returned in such cases.
#' calculate_distance(0, 91, 0, 0) # Returns NA due to invalid latitude
# Calculate distances only for valid coordinates
#' Check if geographic coordinates are on land or water
#' This function takes vectors of longitude and latitude coordinates
#' and determines whether each point is located on land or water using
#' Natural Earth data included in poliprep. It handles missing values gracefully.
#' @param lon Numeric vector of longitude coordinates
#' @param lat Numeric vector of latitude coordinates
#' @return A character vector with "land", "water", or NA for each input
#' # Create a data frame with test coordinates, known locations, and missing
#' # Apply the check_land_water function to the coordinates
#' # Print the results, showing actual and predicted locations
# Get world land polygons and lakes
# Create a data frame with input coordinates
# Create points from valid input coordinates
# Check if points intersect with land
# Check if points intersect with lakes
# Determine if points are on land, in lakes, or in ocean
#' Performs various checks on geographic data, including coordinate flipping,
#' land/water checks, missing coordinate checks, and more. Provides CLI output
#' @param data A dataframe containing the geographic data to be checked.
#' @param shapefile_data Optional. A dataframe with reference shapefile data.
#' @param join_key_a Column name in data to join with shapefile data.
#' @param join_key_b Optional. Column name in shapefile_data to join with data.
#' Defaults to "ADM2_GUID" if shapefile_data is NULL.
#' @param lat_col Name of the latitude column in the data.
#' @param lon_col Name of the longitude column in the data.
#' @param correct_lat_col Optional. Name of correct latitude column in
#' shapefile_data. Defaults to "CENTER_LAT" if shapefile_data is NULL.
#' @param correct_lon_col Optional. Name of correct longitude column in
#' shapefile_data. Defaults to "CENTER_LON" if shapefile_data is NULL.
#' @param checks Character vector specifying checks to perform. Options:
#' @param aggregate_by Optional. Column name(s) to aggregate results by.
#' @param summary_table Logical. If TRUE, returns a summary table instead of
#' @param min_precision Numeric. Minimum decimal places for coordinate
#' @return If summary_table is FALSE, returns input data with additional check
#' columns. If TRUE, returns a summary table of the checks.
# Use poliprep::shp_global if shapefile_data is not provided
parse_failed = if ("parse" %in% checks) TRUE else NULL,
null_count = if ("null_coords" %in% checks) FALSE else NULL,
potentially_flipped = if ("flip" %in% checks) FALSE else NULL,
on_water = if ("on_water" %in% checks) NA_character_ else NULL,
parse_failed = if ("parse" %in% checks) TRUE else NULL,
low_precision = if ("precision" %in% checks) FALSE else NULL,
out_of_bounds = if ("out_of_bounds" %in% checks) FALSE else NULL
parse_failed = if ("parse" %in% checks) NA else NULL
parse_failed = if ("parse" %in% checks) FALSE else NULL
"of bounds.\n Valid lat range is -90 to 90, and ",
"All parsed coordinates are within valid ranges:",
" coordinates with precision below {min_precision} decimal places."
cli::cli_alert_success("No parsed coordinates that were Null (0,0).")
"Cannot perform flipped coord check without shapefile_data."
cli::cli_alert_success("All {land_count} parsed coordinates are on land.")
" on water, the rest are on land."
# bind parsed and non-parsed to make results
#' This function corrects potentially flipped latitude and longitude coordinates
#' by comparing them with a reference shapefile.
#' @param data A dataframe containing the geographical coordinates to be
#' @param shapefile_data Optional. A dataframe containing reference shapefile
#' data. If NULL, `poliprep::shp_global` will be used.
#' @param join_key_a The column name in `data` to join with `shapefile_data`.
#' @param join_key_b Optional. The column name in `shapefile_data` to join with
#' If NULL and `shapefile_data` is NULL, defaults to "ADM2_GUID".
#' @param lat_col The name of the latitude column in `data`.
#' @param lon_col The name of the longitude column in `data`.
#' @param correct_lat_col Optional. The name of the correct latitude column in
#' If NULL and `shapefile_data` is NULL, defaults to "CENTER_LAT".
#' @param correct_lon_col Optional. The name of the correct longitude column
#' If NULL and `shapefile_data` is NULL, defaults to "CENTER_LON".
#' @return A dataframe with corrected latitude and longitude coordinates.
# Use poliprep::shp_global if shapefile_data is not provided

#' @param min_date Start date for data retrieval in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format.

#' @return A data frame containing the requested data aggregated from all pages

#' Try API Call with Retry Logic
#' This function attempts to make an API call to a specified URL using the GET

#' specified number of times (`max_attempts`) before giving up. If the request
#' is successful and returns a 200 status code, the response is returned. If any
#' errors occur or if a non-200 status code is received, the function will wait
#' for 5 seconds and retry the request. After the maximum number of attempts, if
#' the request still fails, the function stops with an error message.
#' @param url The URL for the API endpoint to which the GET request is made.
#' @param token The authorization token required for the API request.
#' @param max_attempts The maximum number of attempts to make the API call.
#' @return The response from the API call if successful, or an error message
